com.esri.mo2.map.core
Class BaseLayout

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.core.BaseLayout
All Implemented Interfaces:
Canvas, ElementContainer, Layout, Searchable, Selectable
Direct Known Subclasses:
PageLayout
public abstract class BaseLayout
extends Object
implements Layout

A layout component that implements Layout model interface. The z-order is like 3 D coordinate system where the most front element has z value of 0. This is consistent with client PageLayout class's Swing component's position value which is kept in Element's position property through set/getPosition API but the z-value doesn't equal to the position property value.

The page extent denotes an area users are interested in, usually the layout page size while the full page extent covers the whole area where all elements occupy.

Method Detail

addElement

public SelectionSet addElement(Element element)
Adds a graphic element at the top of the z-order and returns a SelectionSet that identifies this Element. The SelectionSet can subsequently be used to modify the current selection, if desired, by applying it to the current Selection via the getSelectionSet and/or the setSelectionSet methods

Specified by:
addElement in interface ElementContainer
Parameters:
element - the graphic element
Returns:
a SelectionSet identifying the element just added
See Also:
addElement(Element,int), SelectableLayer.setSelectionSet(com.esri.mo2.data.feat.SelectionSet), SelectableLayer.getSelectionSet()

addElement

public SelectionSet addElement(Element element,
                               int zorder)
                        throws IllegalArgumentException
Adds a graphic element with immediate z-order value specified. Z-order is a "hint" for where to place the Element in the z-order hierarchy and if <= 0 will be placed at the bottom of the z-order (will be drawn first). If zorder >= size() then the Element will be placed at the top of z-order, i.e. will be drawn last.

Specified by:
addElement in interface ElementContainer
Parameters:
element - the graphic element
zorder - the initial z-order of the Element
Returns:
a SelectionSet identifying the element just added
IllegalArgumentException
See Also:
addElement(Element)

bringForward

public void bringForward(Element element)
Brings an Element forward, that is it moves the element "above" the immediate next Element in the z-order. Note that the z coordinate started with zero as the most front element.

Specified by:
bringForward in interface ElementContainer
Parameters:
element - the Element to bring forward

getFullExtent

public Envelope getFullExtent()
Get a copy of the full extent property. The full page extent covers the whole area where all elements occupy while the current page extent covers the area you are interesting in, which usually is the layout page size.

Specified by:
getFullExtent in interface Canvas
Returns:
the full page extent
